item.title: A short intro to type classes in Haskell
item.description: Haskell as a language, always fascinates me with its unique typesystem and constructs that offer expressiveness, like no other languages. Today I want to share something i learned called Type classes in haskell. Let’s create a simple useless function in haskell, to discover what a typeclass is. So here’s our magical function: -- simple_haskell.hs magical x y = (x+y) * (x-y) now, lets load it in ghci real quick,
